website_summaries.verdict: A super-lightweight trailer that is durable, well-constructed, and easy to use and store.
pros: Very lightweight, weighing in at 9.8 pounds
Quick and easy to attach and detach
cons: Kick stand is a little short
Some buyers claim that it tips over easily

customer_reviews.title: Durable, lightweight, collasable bike trailer AND handcart
customer_reviews.text: Superior turn radius. Easy hitch placement. Easy to attach/detach Travoy trailer without sacrificing security. The docking arm on the trailer which attaches to hitch bolt is made of very sturdy rubber which allows unexpected twists resulting from falls or turnovers but also gives flexibility when getting over bumps and uneven terrain. Can be used as a handcart (e.g. at airports when tranporting your deconstructed bikes) can collaspe to a size that fits most standard airline overhead bins without removing wheels. Only downside found thus far is the very handy standing position peg leg is difficult to move from standing to folded position. I would highly recommenf this item for short and long commutes.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Price value fair
customer_reviews.text: Best decision I've ever made buying this product. The ease of storage alone is the best value of this product. See my upper market bag review for rest of My evaluation of this product.
customer_reviews.author: MOON

customer_reviews.title: This trolley is the perfect size and light enough for him to safely pull ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 12-year old's bike. He gets himself to and from school and he plays the tenor sax. This trolley is the perfect size and light enough for him to safely pull behind his bike. I was concerned it might not work with a 24" kids bike, but it works just fine. I also ordered the rain fly, and my son had no problems using it the last time it rained.
customer_reviews.author: KCS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the purpose!
customer_reviews.text: I needed this so I could transport my inflatable kayak on my folding bike, providing me a way to park at the takeout point, ride the bike to the put in - and then put the trailer and bike on the kayak for the trip downstream. It has an added bonus of also serving as a hand truck, for those situations where I have to park at a distance from put in/take-out. It folds nicely. The only negligible negative is that one has to be careful when loading to make sure the cargo does not rub against the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Joann Prinzivalli

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I strap two large beach chairs with a budgie cord and a beach bag to this bike trailer and ride to beach daily. Great product. Saves me a ton on parking in OCNJ. Worth every penny. Has no problem being pulled across sandy beach either. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Jacoby

customer_reviews.title: Versatile cart, well constructed and compact.
customer_reviews.text: Very useful as bike trailer and hand cart. Fits in elevator while attached to full-sized bike. Folds up very small. Three minor issues: Stand release is hard to push in. Wheels have some play, with no affect on performance. Bag rubs on wheels sometimes. Overall, it is an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H.

customer_reviews.title: Inventive and portable gear transporter for your bike.  Works pretty nice!
customer_reviews.text: If you've got the coin and the design suits you then you are set! I was looking for something a little more modern then a pull-behind trailer(which stick so far out) yet a folding design that I could pack away into a small space when not in use. The upright characteristics of this unit give it potentials that I need for my utilization purposes. I went with the yellow design because it gives a more sporting look then the black "cargo" color and is more noticeable when on the road. There's a few reviews on Youtube that helped me make my final decision on the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Best way to carry groceries home from the store
customer_reviews.text: Best way to carry groceries home from the store. This thing saves me tons of gas and time, as an alternative to using a car. And it's super convenient to take in the store with you, and load up as you go. Most people think it's a baby cart. A few notice it's something different, and they usually ask where I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Light, strong and very adaptable

customer_reviews.title: Works well - great for picnics
customer_reviews.text: Works well - great for picnics! I like the way it folds for storage. My bike is a 26" frame and towing the trailer was a breeze.
